nodes.bodyText: ExtraCredentialAuthenticationConfig or ExtracCredentialCredentialConfig? Because we are using extra credentials infra to pass to authentication credentials.

Either of those seem redundant to me. This class configures how we use "extra credentials" for the JDBC connector. The phrase "authentication credential" seems redundant given that the purpose of a credential is to be used for authentication.
I'll leave this for now, but we can follow up and rename if you feel strongly about it.
Commit message looks invalid. You are not using methods, but modules.

This is using @Provides methods (which live inside modules) rather than a Provider. I've always called these "provider" methods but I'll update this to be @Provides since that matches the Guice documentation.

Actually, I see your point, this change is about both using @Provides methods and switching to explicit modules, so I'll update the message to reflect that. It previously used implicit/inline modules with providers.
